Entries.default: A dirty, naked man presses the length of his body up against the bars.
"You got the key or not?"
"Here's the one that saved our skins!"
"Keep it quiet, and follow me, mates."
"Run like the wind, mates!"
"Psst! You, over here!"
"Hello, swabby."
"You ain't one of Benny's. What're you doing here?"
"Lamond sent me to free you."
"I'm looking for Benweth."
[Bribe him.] "You sure I'm not one of the Drake's crew?"
"What are YOU doing here?"
"Knew we could count on our captain. Always looking out for us, he is."
"I could tell you where he is - if you're interested in an exchange."
"Now I know you're not. But I'm no squealer. I'll even pay back your kindness if you'll let me."

"You see, Brutal Ben's locked me and my mates down here to torment our noble captain, Lamond.

"They had what you might call a disagreement."
"The captain's a good man to have at your back, especially for anyone who's fallen into Benweth's sights."
"Let us free, and we and our captain will owe you a favor."
"I have the key."
"Where would I find the key?"
"Why's Benweth punishing Lamond?"
"Farewell."
"Let us out, and we make it past the guards."
"The jailer does her rounds from time to time, but getting the ring off her person might be challenging. Without alerting the other guards, that is."
"I'd wager she keeps a spare set at her post."
"Down the hall, southeastern end of the dungeons. Watch out for guards on a stroll-about."
"Benny's the top of the top. Second only to Aeldys in these parts. He's unbeatable, some say. Too much of a brute for his own good, I think."
"Lamond knew him back in the Dyrwoodan navy - before he grew into his britches, and that chafes Benweth."
"One night, our captain breaks a bottle against Benweth's first mate. Now we're rotting in here while Lamond works the forge like peeling potatoes."
He gestures to the grimy, straw- and shit-strewn cell around him.
"So, what do you say?" Fingers trembling, he runs his palms over the bars.
"Seeing as you've let us out of the brig, I'd say we owe you. So you ought to speak with our captain in the forge. It's up the stairs on the western end."
"Keep it quiet, and follow me, mates."
